documents.document:
How to Find the Best Parts Washer

When a business needs to clean the parts that it creates, it needs a good parts washer or two. The key to finding a goods parts washer is to evaluate your needs and to do your research. Once you know what you need, you can find the perfect machine for your business.

What You Need

If you are buying a new parts washer or upgrading from an older model, you will want to consider your company’s needs. For example, how many parts do you produce on a daily basis? How many parts do you need cleaned on a daily basis? Parts washers come in different sizes with different capacities. If you only need to clean a small to moderate amount of parts each day or each week, you do not want to spend money on a very large parts washer.

You also want to consider the parts themselves. What are your parts made of and how large are your parts? Are they very delicate or very durable? Are they very complex with things like blind holes or are they relatively simple in shape? Some types of parts cleaning methods are more effective than others, but you do not need a very efficient cleaning method if you only need to get the majority of the contaminants off of your parts. However, for something delicate, like medical instruments, you need a very efficient and effective cleaning method.

Having an idea of what you need in a parts washer will help you when you start looking for them.

The Types of Parts Washers

When it comes to the machines that clean parts, you have a number of options. For example, some machines use an aqueous or water based solution while some use solvents. Some parts are best cleaned by aqueous solutions, and some companies find this method more convenient because they do not want to handle solvents. However, these days with solvent recovery systems, these cleaners are also very useful and easy to use.

Ultrasonic cleaning and vapour degreasing are two cleaning methods that these machines can use. Ultrasonic cleaning, for example, can be used with solvents and with aqueous solutions. This method involves using ultrasonic sound waves, which cause the solution to vibrate. This vibration creates cavitation bubbles, which implode, helping to clean contaminants from your parts.

Vapour degreasing typically uses a solvent. The parts are placed into the parts washer, and the solvent is heated in a vacuum causing it to vaporise. The vapour adheres to the parts and cools, which causes it to condense and drip off of the parts. When the solvent drips off of the parts, it removes contaminants.

Kumi Solutions

If you need a parts washer in the UK, you should contact Kumi Solutions. Whether you have large parts or small parts, whether you need an aqueous cleaning solution or a solvent cleaning solution, whether you need a large parts washer or a small one, the employees at Kumi Solutions can help you. You can even visit their facility to test out a parts washer or two using your own parts!

How to Find the Best Parts Washer

When a business needs to clean the parts that it creates, it needs a good parts washer or two. The key to finding a goods parts washer is to evaluate your needs and to do your research. Once you know what you need, you can find the perfect machine for your business.

What You Need

If you are buying a new parts washer or upgrading from an older model, you will want to consider your company’s needs. For example, how many parts do you produce on a daily basis? How many parts do you need cleaned on a daily basis? Parts washers come in different sizes with different capacities. If you only need to clean a small to moderate amount of parts each day or each week, you do not want to spend money on a very large parts washer.

You also want to consider the parts themselves. What are your parts made of and how large are your parts? Are they very delicate or very durable? Are they very complex with things like blind holes or are they relatively simple in shape? Some types of parts cleaning methods are more effective than others, but you do not need a very efficient cleaning method if you only need to get the majority of the contaminants off of your parts. However, for something delicate, like medical instruments, you need a very efficient and effective cleaning method.

Having an idea of what you need in a parts washer will help you when you start looking for them.

The Types of Parts Washers

When it comes to the machines that clean parts, you have a number of options. For example, some machines use an aqueous or water based solution while some use solvents. Some parts are best cleaned by aqueous solutions, and some companies find this method more convenient because they do not want to handle solvents. However, these days with solvent recovery systems, these cleaners are also very useful and easy to use.

Ultrasonic cleaning and vapour degreasing are two cleaning methods that these machines can use. Ultrasonic cleaning, for example, can be used with solvents and with aqueous solutions. This method involves using ultrasonic sound waves, which cause the solution to vibrate. This vibration creates cavitation bubbles, which implode, helping to clean contaminants from your parts.

Vapour degreasing typically uses a solvent. The parts are placed into the parts washer, and the solvent is heated in a vacuum causing it to vaporise. The vapour adheres to the parts and cools, which causes it to condense and drip off of the parts. When the solvent drips off of the parts, it removes contaminants.

Kumi Solutions

If you need a parts washer in the UK, you should contact Kumi Solutions. Whether you have large parts or small parts, whether you need an aqueous cleaning solution or a solvent cleaning solution, whether you need a large parts washer or a small one, the employees at Kumi Solutions can help you. You can even visit their facility to test out a parts washer or two using your own parts!
